body_html:
Hey @nbogis, I think that's a very good improvement, sorry for all this confusion. The menu on desktop still looks a little weird, but I think it just needs some small CSS improvements and will be good to go. See screenshot below.

Before you take a look at that, could you sync your fork and PR with the master branch? There are a few conflicts and since some changes have also been made to the global css file, I want to make sure you have the latest changes :)
From your PR branch, you should be able to run git merge master. It will complain about merge conflicts, after which you can go into both _header.html.slim and global.sass and fix the conflicts manually. You can find a nice and short tutorial about resolving conflicts here but let me know if you need assistance with that, I'd be happy to help you.

Thanks for your patience!

body: Hey @nbogis, I think that's a very good improvement, sorry for all this confusion. The menu on desktop still looks a little weird, but I think it just needs some small CSS improvements and will be good to go. See screenshot below. Before you take a look at that, could you sync your fork and PR with the master branch? There are a few conflicts and since some changes have also been made to the global css file, I want to make sure you have the latest changes :) From your PR branch, you should be able to run `git merge master`. It will complain about merge conflicts, after which you can go into both `_header.html.slim` and `global.sass` and fix the conflicts manually. You can find a nice and short tutorial about resolving conflicts [here](https://githowto.com/resolving_conflicts) but let me know if you need assistance with that, I'd be happy to help you. Thanks for your patience!
